sentences.sContent: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
sentences.sCn: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩，你俩在一起看起来多幸福。

sentences.sContent: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
sentences.sCn: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

sentences.sContent: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy(= feeling a lot of envy ).
sentences.sCn: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

sentences.sContent: ...We envy famous men and imagine that fame was due to some trick of luck...

remMethod.val: “安慰” → 因为妒忌， 安慰都显得假惺惺 → 妒忌

words.tran: 值得羡慕的；引起忌妒的

trans.tranOther: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
the feeling of wanting something that someone else has
